revised_title: On the Variations of the Daily Range of the Magnetic Declination at Kew Observatory
tldr: The author analyzes the daily range of the magnetic declination at Kew Observatory from 1858 to 1873, finding that the maximum range occurs around the summer solstice and that there is a long-period variation connected to the sun's surface. The study provides insights into the Earth's magnetic activity and its relationship with solar influences.
